text.section: This section applies only to Carroll and Washington counties.

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Transient or temporary vendors" means all persons, partnerships, corporations, or other legal entities, and their principals and agents, who:
Engage in a business for the purpose of selling or soliciting orders for the sale of goods, wares, or merchandise;
Are located in 1 location or travel from place to place;
Have the intent to continue this business in Washington County or in Carroll County for a period of a year or less; and
For the purpose of conducting this business, rent, use, or occupy the following:
Buildings, including:
Any lots or parcels of land including:
Motor or nonmotorized vehicles of any type including:
"Date of issuance" means the date on which the license is actually obtained by the vendor and the date the vendor may legally proceed with business.

"Nonenclosed shopping center" means a nonenclosed commercial complex:
Located on one parcel of ground and containing at least 450,000 square feet of floor space; and
Containing at least 100 retail establishments.
This subsection applies only to Carroll County.

In a proceeding to prosecute a violation of this section or to enforce the provisions of this section, there is a presumption that a person conducting a business intends to continue the business for 1 year or less if the business is not open for business at least 5 days during each week and at least 50 weeks during the year.

text.section:
The county commissioners of each county may:
License and regulate persons who conduct a transient or temporary business; and
Require a license to be obtained before conducting business within the county.

section.section: The promoter, sponsor, or other person organizing a convention, show, or sale that includes at least 10 participants shall pay a license fee and obtain a license in accordance with the provisions of this section.
Transient vendors participating in a convention, show, or sale licensed according to this subsection may not be required to obtain a separate transient vendor's license.

An applicant for a transient vendor's license shall execute and file a bond in the amount of $10,000 with the county commissioners of the county in which the vendor intends to do business along with a surety qualified to do business in the State and approved by the county commissioners of that county.
The bond shall be payable to the extent of any taxes, fees, or fines.
The surety shall indemnify a purchaser who suffers a loss by reason of defective merchandise or misrepresentation.

The bond shall provide that the county commissioners of the county in which the vendor intends to do business may file suit in their own name against the licensee or surety on the bond for taxes, fees, or fines due from the licensee that are not paid within 30 days of the termination of the sale or license.
The bond shall provide that a purchaser at a sale may maintain an action against a licensee or surety for claims arising from the sale.

The bond shall continue in effect for 1 year after the termination of the transient vendor's license, and until all actions are concluded and judgments have been satisfied or until the amount of bond has been exhausted by these payments.
The bond shall be in addition to all deposits, license fees, permit fees, or other requirements under the law of the county in which the vendor intends to do business.
The applicant shall deposit a sum of cash which is equivalent to the full amount that would be due for the license based on the estimated time that the license will be required.
The county commissioners of the county in which the vendor intends to do business shall verify the statements made by the applicant contained in the application for the license.
If a false statement is contained in the application, the license may be denied and if denied, a refund shall be made, less administrative costs.

If the county commissioners of the county in which the vendor intends to do business approve the application and the surety bond, and the license fee is paid, the county commissioners of that county shall issue the license within 20 days of the application date.
The license shall be for the duration and term applied for in the application, and shall terminate automatically.

A transient vendor shall pay the following license fee to each county in which the vendor intends to do business before commencing business:
A minimum of $1,000, which shall cover a period of 1 month or less from the date of issuance; and
The sum of $500 for each additional month or portion of a month.
The maximum amount payable for a license shall be $3,500.
The license shall be issued for 1 year or less.
A transient vendor may not engage in business without first obtaining the necessary license required under this section.

This section does not exempt a vendor from obtaining any other license or permit of the United States, the State, the county in which the vendor intends to do business, or the City of Hagerstown if the vendor intends to do business in Hagerstown, or from being subjected to liability, tax liability, or any other regulations that may be applicable in the United States, the State, the county in which the vendor intends to do business, or the City of Hagerstown if the vendor intends to do business in Hagerstown.
Unless otherwise permitted by law, a licensed transient vendor may not sell goods, wares, or merchandise on Sunday.

text.section: A person who engages in a transient business in violation of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction, shall be subject to a fine not to exceed $2,500 or imprisonment for not more than 1 year, or both.

section.section: In Washington County, law enforcement personnel from the City of Hagerstown if the vendor intends to do business in Hagerstown, Washington County, and the State may enforce compliance with the provisions of this section.

In Carroll County, law enforcement personnel from the State, Carroll County, or any municipal corporation in Carroll County may enforce compliance with the provisions of this section within their respective jurisdictions.
